content.question: A particle is moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis under the influence of a spring force <math alttext="F sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The potential energy <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the particle as a function of position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by the equation <math alttext="U of x equals beta x to the 4 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="beta equals one half joules per meter to the 4 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>J</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>4</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The magnitude of <math alttext="F sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> when the particle is at the position <math alttext="x equals 0.1 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 6 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5 times 10 to the negative 5 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 3 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5 times 10 to the negative 2 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 1 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 3 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
